title: Age
desc: Most blood donation organizations require donors to be within a specific age range, often between 18 and 65.

title: Health Status
desc: Donors should be in good health on the day of donation, without symptoms of illness.

title: Medical History
desc: Some medications or medical conditions may affect eligibility. Medical history and current medications are considered.

title: Lifestyle
desc: Certain lifestyle choices, such as recent body piercings, tattoos, or use of intravenous drugs, may lead to deferral.

title: Pregnancy
desc: Pregnant individuals are typically deferred from donating, and guidelines may exist for breastfeeding individuals.

title: Frequency
desc: Guidelines exist on how often donors can give blood to allow for adequate recovery between donations.

title: Travel-Related
desc: Travel to specific high-risk areas for infectious diseases may lead to temporary deferrals.

title: Specific Health
desc: Some health conditions, like certain blood disorders or transmissible diseases, may affect eligibility.

title: COVID-19
desc: Blood donation organizations have established guidelines related to COVID-19 and vaccination status.
